'Pentachlorophenol' ('PCP') is an organochlorine compound used as a pesticide
and a disinfectant. First produced in the 1930s, it is marketed under many trade
names. It can be found in two forms: PCP itself or as
the sodium salt of PCP, which dissolves easily in water.
